thread.section_title: Orlando Sentinel- Orlando news, sports and more
thread.title: A makeover for Jack's Steakhouse

author: Kyle Arnold
title: A makeover for Jack's Steakhouse
text:
Kyle Arnold Contact Reporter 
Jack's Steakhouse is getting a long awaited makeover that was put on hold when owner and executive chef Chris Lacey died last summer. 
On Nov. 5, Lacey's parents plan to reopen the Baldwin Park eatery as Provisions & Buzz Co. with a revamped menu and interior. It will close for about a week later this month for the remodel. 
New executive chef Josh Spisak is continuing Lacey's vision of more seafood and other experimental dishes, said Chris's mother Lisa Lacey. 
"Chris wouldn't have wanted us to just walk away," she said. 
Lacey died unexpectedly in his sleep in July 2014, and an exact cause of death was never determined. 
The restaurant also is getting an interior makeover, with brighter colors to replace the traditional steakhouse look of dark woods. 
Want to try something new? Check out these restaurants and retailers that have recently set up shop here in the Central Florida area.
